content: A stupid question (I've been told there is no such thing, but this may disprove): what's the standard etiquette on wasmtime/cranelift repos for merging when a review requests relatively minor changes but approves? Wait for one last look, or just merge when green? I've been on projects that go both ways...
Just merge when green in that case.
Approval with minor changes requested means "I trust these are straightforward that I don't feel another round of review is required"
